aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Financial and Investment Expectations
Amazon expects variability in accounts payable days over time.
Accounts payable days are affected by the mix of product sales.
Accounts payable days are affected by the mix of sales by third-party sellers.
Accounts payable days are affected by the mix of suppliers.
Accounts payable days are affected by seasonality.
Accounts payable days are affected by changes in payment terms over time.
Accounts payable days are affected by changes in other terms over time.
Changes in payment terms with suppliers affect accounts payable days.
Balancing pricing with suppliers affects accounts payable days.
Balancing timing of payment terms with suppliers affects accounts payable days.
Amazon expects spending in technology and infrastructure to increase over time.
Amazon will add computer scientists to increase technology and infrastructure spending.
Amazon will add designers to increase technology and infrastructure spending.
Amazon will add software engineers to increase technology and infrastructure spending.
Amazon will add hardware engineers to increase technology and infrastructure spending.
Amazon will add merchandising employees to increase technology and infrastructure spending.
Amazon's technology and infrastructure investment supports a variety of product and service offerings.
Amazon's capital spending projects support a variety of product and service offerings.
Geographic expansion contributes to the cross-functionality of Amazon's systems and operations.
Amazon seeks to invest efficiently in several areas of technology and infrastructure.
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is an area where Amazon seeks to invest efficiently.
Expansion of new product categories is an area where Amazon seeks to invest efficiently.
Expansion of existing product categories is an area where Amazon seeks to invest efficiently.
Expansion of new service offerings is an area where Amazon seeks to invest efficiently.
Expansion of existing service offerings is an area where Amazon seeks to invest efficiently.
Amazon invests in infrastructure to enhance the customer experience.
Amazon invests in infrastructure to improve process efficiencies.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/

text:
We also expect some variability in accounts payable days over time since they are affected by several factors, including the mix of product sales, the mix of sales by third-party sellers, the mix of suppliers, seasonality, and changes in payment and other terms over time, including the effect of balancing pricing and timing of payment terms with suppliers.

We expect spending in technology and infrastructure will increase over time as we add computer scientists, designers, software and hardware engineers, and merchandising employees. Our technology and infrastructure investment and capital spending projects often support a variety of product and service offerings due to geographic expansion and the cross-functionality of our systems and operations. We seek to invest efficiently in several areas of technology and infrastructure, including AWS, and expansion of new and existing product categories and service offerings, as well as in infrastructure to enhance the customer experience and improve our process efficiencies.
